context: The Estonian word 'grupp' is a noun that means 'group' in English. It can refer to: 1) A small number of people, objects, etc., which are located together or act as one unit (like a team or collection), 2) A set belonging to one category based on similar features in some classification system. The word follows Estonian declension patterns and has various compound forms like 'õppegrupp' (study group) and 'töögrupp' (work group).
